intro: Chorisochora striata, commonly known as the striated sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the Caribbean and the Gulf of Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found growing near the shoreline. Chorisochora striata plays a role in stabilizing coastal dunes and provides habitat for various small invertebrates.
